wikipedia_page.main: Michael Granger (7 October 1931 – 6 November 2016) was an English professional footballer who played as a goalkeeper in the Football League for York City, Hull City and Halifax Town and in non-League football for Cliftonville and Scarborough. He died from complications of Alzheimer's disease at a nursing home in York in 2016.

response: * 6 November 2016: Mick Granger, 85, York City, Hull City and Halifax Town goalkeeper.
*Mick Granger, 85, English footballer (York City), Alzheimer's disease.Former York City goalkeeper Mick Granger dies at the age of 85
